result.execSummary:
The defendant Leville M Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time.  Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.
In lieu of Costs/DNA Surcharge defendant to serve 4 days Jail consecutive to the 60 days, current to any other sentence.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Leville M Perry in court, in custody from MSDF, with attorney Jean Marie La Tour.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney La Tour makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

JAIL: 60 days jail without work release.  (Credit 2 days) Concurrent to any sentence. 

COSTS / DNA Surcharge:   In lieu of costs / DNA surcharge ,Defendant to serve 4 days jail consecutive to the 60 days, concurrent to any other sentence.  

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
